context_bundle.summary: Crypto exchange API patterns: REST vs WebSocket, rate limits, authentication (HMAC), order types, common endpoints for Binance/Coinbase/Kraken/Bybit.

onboarding.quick_start: REST for orders/account. WebSocket for real-time data. Always use HMAC auth. Respect rate limits (Binance: 1200/min). Test on testnet first.
common_patterns: Auth: API key + HMAC-SHA256 signature of request params with secret
Order flow: GET /account → POST /order → GET /order/{id} → DELETE /order/{id}
Market data: WebSocket subscribe to trades/orderbook/klines streams
Rate limits: Weight-based (Binance), per-endpoint (Coinbase), sliding window
Error handling: 429 = rate limited, 418 = IP banned, 1000s = exchange-specific
known_errors: Hitting rate limits - implement exponential backoff
Clock drift causing auth failures - sync NTP regularly
Not handling partial fills - order may fill in chunks
WebSocket disconnect without reconnect logic - missed data
Testing on mainnet - use testnet/sandbox first
